content.title: Femoral Artery Aneurysm
content.description: True aneurysm of the common femoral artery, second most common peripheral aneurysm, often associated with other aneurysmal disease.
content.epidemiology: Mean age 65-70, male predominance, bilateral 50%, associated AAA 50-85%, popliteal 40%

treatment.endovascular: Limited role due to CFA location as access vessel
key_considerations: Often requires endarterectomy of adjacent disease

content.statement: Femoral Artery Aneurysm is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Aneurysms that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Femoral Artery Aneurysm helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Femoral Artery Aneurysm include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Femoral Artery Aneurysm.

citations.source: UpToDate. (2024). Femoral Artery Aneurysm. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
